oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Blanket of Richard Houston Palmer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: White wool panel blanket carried through the war by Pvt. Richard Houston Palmer, Co. D, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. Palmer was from just north of Lebanon, Wilson County, Tenn. Palmer's service records indicate that he was present throughout his enlistment.; The 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA served in the Army of Northern Virginia throughout the war. Palmer was paroled at the end of the war at Appomattox Court House, Virginia on April 9, 1865. This is probably a homemade blanket.
